Description: Body sherd of Attic black-figured pottery Gordion cup; interior: tondo border consisting, from outside, of three bands, two rows of staggered dots separated by dilute line, alternate black and added red tongues with faded added white dots between; exterior black with reserved band.
Curator's comments: The sherd belongs to the same vase as British Museum 1888,0601.237, 1888,0601.324, 1888,0601.426 and 1948,0805.4, which display black-figure decoration, not found on this sherd. The pieces are gathered in Hirayama, H. 2010 Kleitias and Attic Black-figure Vases in the Sixth Century B.C., pl. 26.
Bibliographic references: Brijder Siana III 2000 / Siana Cups III: The Red-black Painter, Griffin-bird Painter, and Siana Cups resembling Lip-cups (p. 556, no. G3) (Ergotimos-Kleitias Group)
Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 381, no. B534)
Venit 1984 / Early Attic Black Figure Vases in Egypt (p. 153, note 82)
Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (p. 321, no. 2)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0414) (Phase 1)
